intro: Aneilema tenerum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture, contributing to its common name. Aneilema tenerum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
